definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: He was supposed to give us advice, but this ideas were airy-fairy ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他应该给我们提些劝告，但他的主意都是不切实际的。

sentences.english: Unpractical expectations make some students disappointed in their college life.
sentences.chinese: 不切实际的期望值使部份学生对大学生活感到失望。

sentences.english: Experts have expressed dismay at the quixotic Soviet-style project.
sentences.chinese: 专家们对这一不切实际的苏联式工程项目表示失望。

sentences.english: Their parents are fantasized by myths about education offered in foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 他们的家长对国外的教育抱有不切实际的幻想。

sentences.english: Most of us have formed an unrealistic picture of life on a desret island.
sentences.chinese: 我们许多人对于荒岛生活都抱着一种不切实际的想法。

sentences.english: Bozo indulged in the most high-flown speculations.
sentences.chinese: 博佐沉入了最最不切实际的幻想中。

sentences.english: But this is an unrealistic expectation.
sentences.chinese: 但这是不切实际的期望。

sentences.english: It wouldn't be practical for us to go all that way just for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我们跑那么远只为了去度个周末实在很不切实际。

sentences.english: Some impractical suggestions were turned down by the committee.
sentences.chinese: 一些不切实际的建议被委员会驳回了。

sentences.english: A disposophobic has a delusional regard for the value of the things he hoards.
sentences.chinese: 囤积癖者对他囤积物的价值都有一种不切实际的预估。

sentences.english: Someones said that her plans of being a star are a dream which can be true.
sentences.chinese: 有人说她那些当明星的计划完全是不切实际的梦想。

sentences.english: And an unrealistic goal like inventing a perpetual motion machine is absolutely meaningless.
sentences.chinese: 而像“发明永动机”这样不切实际的目标则毫无意义。

sentences.english: His desire to be No . 1 is unpractical .
sentences.chinese: 他想要成为第一的渴望是不切实际的。

sentences.english: As for China's development, I don't have unrealistic hopes.
sentences.chinese: 至于中国的发展，我不会有不切实际的希望。

sentences.english: It is not practical to introduce ammonia and carbon dioxide separately into the gypsum slurry.
sentences.chinese: 将氨和二氧化碳分别通进石膏料浆是不切实际的。

sentences.english: The best dreams are always unrealistic to the majority of people.
sentences.chinese: 最精彩的梦想在多数人眼里总是不切实际的。

definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
practical/corresponding to reality/geared to practical situations
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
to daydream/to indulge in wishful thinking
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
